page.title: 09The Village Blacksmiths.
page.content: Mr.G.Perkin,the Endon blacksmith,no longer shoes horses.His main business now involves repairing agricultural machinery.One of his tasks at the moment is to make a new wrought iron sign for the village.This will stand on a wooden post at the entrance to the village,on the Leek side.Many visitors travelling to the National Garden Festival in Stoke next year,will pass through Endon,so the Parish Council commissioned a new sign.Now Mr.Perkin has an electric forge with an electric fan,instead of hand held bellows. For joining metals he has several types of welders,including an oxy-acetylene and a gas one.Recently,he purchased a power hammer which can be used to sharpen steel compressors from road drills.Mr. Perkin also sells barbed wire for fences,gate hooks,nails,bolts and brushes,mainly to local farmers.
